urls.title: Flood & Coast 2021
urls.description: Telford International Centre, UK Following the success of the 2020 digital series, the 2021 Flood and Coast conference and expo is going virtual this year, on 28 June ‚Äì 01 July. Each day will be fully packed with interactive sessions, live exhibition booths, and networking opportunities, with the audience addressing some of the most important issues in FCERM. Flood & Coast delivered again! Great show, very happy to meet existing contacts and make lots of new ones. The IBS brand is growing and this event

text: @janetmanning1 @dhedges_gower @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile @HoggIndependent @Sport_England Where I live, we had a natural grass field with two football pitches with a cricket square between them and three tennis/netball courts which were stripped ready to become a car park. Now we just have a pay-to-play 3G pitch, and a much smaller natural grass football pitch.

text: RT @Against_3G: @janetmanning1 @dhedges_gower @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile @HoggIndependen‚Ä¶
RT @Blacky_Himself: The proof: 1 year post-restoration a previously barren, silt-smothered and fish-impassable section of the River Test no‚Ä¶

@janetmanning1 @dhedges_gower @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile @HoggIndependent @Sport_England Hi Janet, yes, it is. I've been researching this for many years now, mostly sleepless nights, etc, wondering how to stop our govt building more and more. I consider this to be a public health scandal on a par with BSE, thalidomide, asbestos, DuPont and the infected blood scandals https://t.co/22muC5K7Ue

Tyre dust in air pollution.

Sport should be fun and keep you fit not kill you!

Really glad that ECHA are banning it. https://t.co/7ZPx4MpEct

urls.title: Air pollution from tyres up to 1,000 worse than from exhaust, claims study
urls.description: Air pollution from car tyres can be up to 1,000 times worse than from an exhaust, research from Emissions Analytics has suggested. Non-exhaust emissions (NEE) are expected to rise from 7.4% today to 10% of all UK PM2.5‚Ä¶

@Against_3G @janetmanning1 @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile Absolutely crazy or as we say these days...... normal! ü§ëü§¢üòßü•±ü§´ü§•ü§≠ü§î

@dhedges_gower @janetmanning1 @bromleyfc @thameswater @EnvAgencySE @OvergrownT @Mark_A_Goddard @MarcRedmile Yes, it's an absolute waste of our money. Councils (from council tax), clubs, pay about ¬£300 and the FF/FA pays the rest, via Sport England but ultimately from our income tax.
But in the end, our world is paying for it as the pollution from the waste at end of use lasts for ever.

Rewild the world ... as an Environmental scientist, can't agree more as with the man himself #ReWildTheWorld @DolDeBie @Greenpeace @LissadellHouse @SligoEnvNet @UNEP @EnvAgency https://t.co/g0FXdSuAGB

urls.title: 3G Pitches: Is the UK sleepwalking into a public health crisis? - Fully Charged Show
urls.description: Almost three years ago I was enjoying my retirement, making lots of happy memories with my grandchildren. Then I found out that our council wanted to build a 3G rubber crumb football pitch right next door to their primary school. This triggered something that I‚Äô d read earlier about a young goalkeeper getting cancer after playing on these pitches. I had to find out more. This was of concern to me personally as my family and friends enjoy playing and coaching football, as well a s for the 630 pupils who
